title: The Frustration of Understanding

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: Maybe it's just a sign of frustration, and I prefer blaming others for merely trying to understand me, instead of admitting that I don't know whether I want to behave differently.
dialogue.context: Admitting deeper uncertainty about change and blame

scene_context: Evan reveals a profound self-awarenessâ€”his frustration with others' attempts to understand him masks his own uncertainty about whether he wants to change.
narrator_note: The deepest confessions come wrapped in frustration. Evan's admission reveals the core dilemma: it's easier to blame others for trying to understand than to face not knowing if we want to be different.
